intro: Anchusa aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Anchusa aegyptiaca is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
